author: John Beauge
title: Pa. man accused of making threats to FBI found incompetent to stand trial - pennlive.com
text:
WILLIAMSPORT ‚Äî A Montour County man accused of making threats against the FBI has been found mentally incompetent to stand trial.
U.S. Middle District Judge Matthew W. Brann on Thursday ordered the government to hospitalize Thomas Green, 32, of Danville, for up to four months for treatment.
During that time a qualified psychologist or psychiatrist is to determine if there is a substantial probability in the foreseeable future that he will attain the capacity to permit his trial to proceed.
Stories by John Beauge Little League condemns unregulated site offering betting odds on series games Illinois Little League World Series coach grew up, starred in Cumberland County sports Australia team in Little League World Series sets record with triplets Fun day is history, and it‚Äôs time for the Little League World Series games to begin If you purchase a product or register for an account through a link on our site, we may receive compensation. By using this site, you consent to our User Agreement and agree that your clicks, interactions, and personal information may be collected, recorded, and/or stored by us and social media and other third-party partners in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

author: @indiatoday
title: Woman does yoga with snakes in California studio slammed video - India Today
text: Video: Woman does yoga with snakes in California studio, slammed A woman was criticised on social media after a video of her performing 'snake yoga' at a studio in California went viral. Listen to Story In Short - Woman criticised for 'snake yoga' in California - Video by content creator Jen Zhang went viral - Social media users called it 'animal abuse' A woman was brutally slammed by social media users for doing ‚Äòsnake yoga‚Äô at a studio in California. Jen Zhang, a content creator from Los Angeles, documented her experience in a video on Instagram that has gone viral with close to one million views. In the video, Zhang was seen practising yoga on a mat in the studio with a snake coiled around her neck. Ahead of the yoga session spanning over an hour, she was instructed regarding the procedure that involved non-toxic ball pythons. ‚ÄúThis is the only place where you can do snake yoga. It is an hour-long experience where you are paired with your own snake, and you do a snake incorporated yoga routine. I thought it sounded absolutely insane. So, I booked it immediately. When you get there, your instructor and snake handler will give a hands-on rundown on how to handle the snakes properly. Then, you pick a gem randomly. Each one corresponds to one of their eight snakes, and you get to keep the gem as a souvenir. These are non-toxic ball pythons,‚Äù she said in the video. Describing her experience, Zhang said that though she was nervous in the beginning, she was eventually able to concentrate. ‚ÄúI am low-key, a little scared of snakes and have never held one before, so I didn‚Äôt know how this was going to go. I started out pretty nervous. But just in case, snakes can smell fear. I compartmentalised that fear to the back of my soul and definitely got comfy as the class went on. It helps that snakes are super slow. They are also under three pounds and are very smooth and gentle compared to snakeless yoga. I felt a lot more concentrated,‚Äù she added. Watch the video here: Social media users, however, were furious and said that this was nothing but ‚Äúanimal abuse‚Äù. ‚ÄúStop treating animals like commodities or accessories (sic),‚Äù a user said, while others emphasised that this isn‚Äôt yoga at all. ‚ÄúThere is NO animal companionship in yoga. Call it stretching with snakes, but it‚Äôs not yoga at all. Do some research before blatantly disrespecting an ancient wellness practice (sic).‚Äù ‚ÄúPersonally, I don't agree with using animals in yoga. They're not an exercise accessory and add unnecessary risk (sic),‚Äù a comment reads. Also called the royal python, the ball python is a species native to West and Central Africa, where it lives in grasslands, shrubs and forests.

author: The Canadian Press
title: Canada ‚Äòwill be there‚Äô to help 2 Michaels after their detention in China: Trudeau
text: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is pushing back on the notion that Canada‚Äôs willingness to help two citizens who were detained in China is an acknowledgement they engaged in espionage on Ottawa‚Äôs behalf. The federal government will be there to help Michael Kovrig and Michael Spavor rebuild their lives after they were arbitrarily imprisoned in China for three years, Trudeau said Thursday. Canada has assisted Kovrig and Spavor from the beginning because China chose to use them as pawns in geopolitical games, Trudeau told a news conference in Toronto. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been there to support the two Michaels, who went through unimaginable difficulties, being arbitrarily detained by China,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe will continue to be there to support them.‚Äù He said China arrested the Canadians for political reasons, adding there was ‚Äúabsolutely no justification, no reason, no excuse for them to do that.‚Äù Trudeau‚Äôs comments came a day after John Phillips, a lawyer for Spavor, indicated his client had reached a settlement with the federal government over the detention. Phillips said in an email that the matter between Spavor and the government had been ‚Äúresolved.‚Äù Trudeau declined to say Thursday whether Ottawa had provided compensation to Kovrig, citing a need for confidentiality. Canada arrested Meng Wanzhou, a senior executive of Chinese firm Huawei Technologies, in December 2018 at the request of the United States, where she faced charges related to American sanctions against Iran. The move clearly angered Beijing, and Kovrig and Spavor ‚Äî two Canadians working in China ‚Äî were arrested soon after on accusations of endangering national security, a move widely seen as retaliation against Ottawa. Kovrig and Spavor were both convicted of spying in 2021 in closed Chinese courts. Canada and many allies said the process amounted to arbitrary detention on bogus charges in an unaccountable justice system. The U.S. worked out a deferred prosecution agreement in Meng‚Äôs case, allowing for her release, and Beijing permitted the two Michaels, as they came to be known, to fly home in September 2021. Jim Bronskill, The Canadian Press

author: Republished By Plato
title: PM Modi‚Äôs Outreach To Putin Helped Prevent ‚ÄòPotential Nuclear Attack‚Äô On Ukraine In Late 2022: CNN Report
text:
PM Modi‚Äôs Outreach To Putin Helped Prevent ‚ÄòPotential Nuclear Attack‚Äô On Ukraine In Late 2022: CNN Report
Washington: As the Russia-Ukraine conflict raged in 2022, the United States started ‚Äúpreparing rigorously‚Äù for a potential nuclear strike by Moscow against Kyiv, in what would have been the first nuclear attack since the US dropping atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki nearly eighty years before, CNN reported citing two senior administration officials.
The report stated that outreach from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other countries also played an important role in averting the crisis.
The Biden administration was specifically concerned Russia might use a tactical or battlefield nuclear weapon, the officials said.
Amid the fears, the US sought to enlist the help of non-allies including India, to discourage Russia from such an attack, as reported by CNN.
‚ÄúOne of the things we did was not only message them directly but strongly urge, press, encourage other countries, to whom they might be more attentive, to do the same thing,‚Äù the senior administration official said.
US officials say that outreach and public statements from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and others helped avert a crisis.
‚ÄúI think we believe showing the international community the concern about this, particularly the concern from key countries for Russia and the Global South, was also a helpful, persuasive factor and showed them what the cost of all this could be,‚Äù CNN quoted a senior administration official as saying.
‚ÄúI think the fact that we know, India weighed in, China weighed in, others weighed in, may have had some effect on their thinking,‚Äù the senior administration official added. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt demonstrate this positively, but I think that‚Äôs our assessment.‚Äù
Regarding the Russia-Ukraine conflict, India has always condemned civilian killings and called for a peaceful resolution to the conflict.
In a major statement, PM Modi told President Putin that ‚Äúthis is not the era of war‚Äù on the sidelines of the SCO summit in Uzbekistan last year. The statement even made to the G20 communique under the presidency of India.
During this period from late summer to fall 2022, the National Security Council convened a series of meetings to put contingency plans in place ‚Äúin the event of either a very clear indication that they were about to do something, attack with a nuclear weapon, or if they just did, how we would respond, how we would try to preempt it or deter it,‚Äù the senior administration official said.
Notably, late summer 2022 was also proving a ‚Äòdevastating period‚Äô for Russian forces in Ukraine. Ukrainian forces were advancing on Russian-occupied Kherson in the south, the city which had been Russia‚Äôs biggest prize since the invasion.
As these Ukrainian forces advanced, entire Russian units were in danger of being surrounded. The view inside the administration was that such a catastrophic loss could be a ‚Äúpotential trigger‚Äù for the use of nuclear weapons, according to CNN.
Also, at the same time, Russia was allegedly circulating a new ‚Äúfalse flag story‚Äù about a Ukrainian dirty bomb, which US officials feared could be intended as a cover for a Russian nuclear attack.
In October 2022, Russia‚Äôs defence minister, Sergei Shoigu, made a series of phone calls to defence officials in the US, the UK, France and Turkey, telling them that the Kremlin was ‚Äúconcerned about possible provocations by Kyiv involving the use of a dirty bomb.‚Äù
But, it is pertinent to note that at no time did the US detect intelligence indicating Russia was taking steps to mobilize its nuclear forces to carry out such an attack, CNN reported.
‚ÄúWe obviously placed a high priority on tracking and had some ability at least to track such movements of its nuclear forces,‚Äù a senior administration official said. ‚ÄúAnd at no point did we ever see any indications of types of steps that we would‚Äôve expected them to take if they were going down a path toward using nuclear weapons.‚Äù
This report is auto-generated from a syndicated feed

author: Juan Felipe Rodr√≠guez
title: EDP Renewables abandona definitivamente sus parques e√≥licos en La Guajira pese a aval de la ANLA
text:
EDP Renewables abandona definitivamente sus parques e√≥licos en La Guajira pese a aval de la ANLA
Aunque la ANLA dej√≥ en firme la licencia ambiental para la l√≠nea el√©ctrica de conexi√≥n en La Guajira, EDP Renewables ratific√≥ su decisi√≥n de abandonar el pa√≠s y no continuar con los parques e√≥licos Alpha y Beta.
La empresa EDP Renewables (EDPR), operadora de los proyectos e√≥licos Alpha y Beta en el norte de La Guajira, reiter√≥ que no retomar√° la construcci√≥n de estas iniciativas en Colombia, pese a la decisi√≥n reciente de la Autoridad Nacional de Licencias Ambientales (ANLA) de dejar en firme la licencia ambiental para la infraestructura el√©ctrica requerida.
Le puede interesar:
En un comunicado, la compa√±√≠a confirm√≥ que ya fue notificada del acto administrativo mediante el cual la ANLA resolvi√≥ el recurso de reposici√≥n que EDPR hab√≠a interpuesto. No obstante, aclar√≥ que la respuesta del ente ambiental no modifica la decisi√≥n comunicada desde diciembre de 2024, cuando anunci√≥ su salida del mercado colombiano.
‚ÄúEDPR ya ha dado inicio al proceso de disoluci√≥n y liquidaci√≥n de las sociedades Vientos del Norte y Eolos Energ√≠a‚Äù, indic√≥ la empresa, que atribuye su retirada a una combinaci√≥n de factores: retrasos en la emisi√≥n de licencias, restricciones de mercado y condiciones que, seg√∫n afirman, son responsabilidad del Gobierno.
El proyecto de interconexi√≥n, que busca enlazar los parques e√≥licos con la subestaci√≥n Cuestecitas atravesando los municipios de Uribia, Maicao y Albania, hab√≠a sido catalogado por el Gobierno como clave para la transici√≥n energ√©tica.
La ministra de Ambiente, Lena Estrada, lo defini√≥ como ‚Äúesencial para avanzar hacia una transici√≥n energ√©tica justa‚Äù, mientras que la directora de la ANLA, Irene V√©lez, asegur√≥ que la decisi√≥n se bas√≥ en ‚Äúcriterios t√©cnicos, jur√≠dicos y ambientales‚Äù.
A pesar de su salida, EDPR expres√≥ su disposici√≥n a colaborar en un eventual proceso de transferencia de los proyectos hacia un tercero, siempre que se den condiciones adecuadas y que el Gobierno juegue un papel activo para garantizar esa transici√≥n.
Durante su operaci√≥n en el pa√≠s, EDPR asegur√≥ haber cumplido con todas sus obligaciones energ√©ticas y contractuales. Sin embargo, la empresa insisti√≥ en que las barreras estructurales y los incumplimientos institucionales limitaron el desarrollo del sector e√≥lico, particularmente en La Guajira, donde varios proyectos enfrentan bloqueos similares.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->energy and resource

author: Juan Manuel Compte
title: Fate y Bridgestone no acompa√±aron a Pirelli y la amenaza de conflicto vuelve a la industria del neum√°tico - El Cronista
text: El fabricante de cubiertas Pirelli present√≥ este jueves una √∫ltima propuesta salarial que no s√≥lo fue rechazada por el gremio, sino que tampoco cont√≥ con el apoyo de Fate ni de Bridgestone. En consecuencia, el Sindicato √önico de Trabajadores del Neum√°tico Argentino (Sutna) dio por rota la negociaci√≥n paritaria y se declar√≥ en estado de alerta.Hace dos a√±os, el sector protagoniz√≥ uno de los conflictos sindicales m√°s feroces de los √∫ltimos tiempos, con cinco meses de paros y bloqueos que llev√≥ al freno total de la producci√≥n de neum√°ticos, que tambi√©n arrastr√≥ a la industria automotriz. Hubo paz despu√©s de un acuerdo con mecanismos de ajustes que le garantizaron al gremio estar siempre por encima de inflaci√≥n. Este a√±o, la negociaci√≥n se fraccion√≥ por per√≠odos. El mes pasado, se hab√≠a acordado un 4,6% remunerativo y acumulativo para los haberes de junio, calculado sobre los haberes de mayo. Quedaba por definir la suba de julio, a partir de los salarios del mes previo. La negociaci√≥n paritaria transcurri√≥ en un clima tensionado por los pedidos de apertura de procedimientos preventivos de crisis (PPC) por parte de Fate y de Bridgestone.Este jueves, a trav√©s de una audiencia virtual, Pirelli propuso un aumento del 4% acumulativo y remunerativo sobre los valores y adicionales vigentes al 30 de junio, a partir del 1o de julio, con la promesa de continuar analizando la situaci√≥n mes a mes para la siguientes actualizaciones.Fate y Bridgestone expresaron "no estar en condiciones" de acompa√±arla. "Tal como venimos advirtiendo hace a√±os, la actividad del neum√°tico, desde hace tiempo, se encuentra atravesando una situaci√≥n compleja, que combina -entre otras variables- una fuerte contracci√≥n de la demanda, p√©rdidas en el mercado exportador, un auemnto sostenido de los stocks y de los costos operativos, todo ello, dentro de un marco de baja competitividad", argumentaron.Esto dio pie a la respuesta de Alejandro Crespo, secretario general del Sutna. "La falta de una propuesta unificada y, por tanto, v√°lida de las patronales, habiendo transcurrido ya un mes y medio sin propuesta salarial v√°lida alguna, rompe la negociaci√≥n en el caracter de la buena fe y plantea, de hecho, un intento de imprimir una rebaja salarial", se lee en el acta de la audiencia."Por todo esto, el gremio del neum√°tico queda en estado de alerta y movilizaci√≥n", agreg√≥.Trabajo cit√≥ a una nueva audiencia el jueves pr√≥ximo.La relaci√≥n del Sutna con las f√°bricas es de alta inflamabilidad. Crespo se ve seguido las caras con las de los negociadores de las empresas en distintas audiencias, tanto de Trabajo como de autoridades provinciales. El Sutna rechaz√≥ los pedidos de PPC de Fate y Bridgestone. Con la japonesa, adem√°s, tiene frecuente escaramuzas. Las m√°s recientes, por el planteo de despidos (m√°s de 400), que se present√≥ como uno de los escenarios a seguir en el proceso del PPC. Aunque la empresa desliz√≥ su intenci√≥n de no recortar fuentes de trabajo, lo concreto es que recurri√≥ al instrumento -que, bajo el paraguas de Trabajo, le permite flexibilizar condiciones del convenio colectivo- debido a su p√©rdida de competitividad, en gran parte, gracias a los frecuentes conflictos internos que padece desde aquella gran puja de 2022.Antes de ese conflicto, Bridgestone hab√≠a invertido u$s 220 millones para ampliar su capacidad de producci√≥n. En 2021, tom√≥ 350 personas para sumar un nuevo turno de producci√≥n, con miras al incremento de su actividad para exportaci√≥n. Pero, despu√©s de los paros y bloqueos del Sutna de 2022, perdi√≥ mercados a manos de otras filiales y, hoy, exporta s√≥lo el 10% de proyectado en su plan de negocios.Por eso, en febrero, ya hab√≠a despedido a 80 personas, sobre un plantel total de 1600. La fuerte p√©rdida de volumen de exportaci√≥n, sumada a la ca√≠da del mercado interno, fue la raz√≥n principal que la llev√≥ a solicitar el PPC ante la Secretar√≠a de Trabajo.El desplome de entregas dom√©sticas, con la consecuente acumulaci√≥n de stocks, fue tambi√©n la raz√≥n que aleg√≥ Fate en el pedido de apertura de su propio procedimiento.

author: Alana Wise
title: Prada and Axiom Space reveal modernized NASA spacesuits for the 2026 moon landing | Interlochen Public Radio
text:
Prada and Axiom Space reveal modernized NASA spacesuits for the 2026 moon landing
By Alana Wise Published October 17, 2024 at 5:45 PM EDT
Image courtesy of Prada / Axiom Space / Image courtesy of Prada / Axiom Space The new suits are designed to keep astronauts safe and flexible as America seeks to renew its moon explorations. NASA‚Äôs new space suits are getting a hand from Italian luxury fashion house Prada in preparation for humanity‚Äôs 2026 return to the moon‚Äôs surface.
Axiom Space and Prada debuted the flight design of the Axiom Extravehicular Mobility Unit (AxEMU) spacesuit this week at the International Astronautical Congress in Milan.
The suit is expected to be used for NASA‚Äôs historic Artemis III mission in 2026, marking humankind‚Äôs first return to the moon since 1972.
‚ÄúOur elite teams have redefined spacesuit development, establishing new pathways to innovative solutions and applying a state-of-the-art design approach for the AxEMU,‚Äù said Matt Ondler, president of Axiom Space. ‚ÄúWe have broken the mold.‚Äù
Image courtesy of Prada / Axiom Space / Image courtesy of Prada / Axiom Space / Image courtesy of Prada / Axiom Space Design for the Axiom Space, Prada spacesuit that will see the first woman and person of color land on the moon. The modernized suits are meant foremost to keep astronauts safe in the throes of space‚Äôs harsh environment, with improved mobility from earlier designs as a close second mandate.
In its release announcing the suit designs, Axiom Space said the suits have improved flexibility, performance and safety and offer specialized tools for scientists‚Äô missions.
The suit is one size fits all and includes lights, an HD camera, 4G/LTE communications, and in-suit nutrition.
‚ÄúIt will withstand extreme temperatures at the lunar south pole and endure the coldest temperatures in the permanently shadowed regions for at least two hours. Astronauts will be able to perform spacewalks for at least eight hours," the press release announcing the new design said.
America has long dreamed about returning its astronauts to the moon, but the U.S. space program has been plagued by technical delays and a lack of funding.
In 2019, the Trump administration directed NASA to land humans on the moon‚Äôs unexplored southern lunar pole by 2024, with the ultimate goal of eventually landing an earthling on Mars.
However, the program was delayed partly because of failures to meet spacesuit design criteria in time.
When launched, the Artemis III mission will see the first woman and the first person of color traverse the low-gravity lunar surface.
Axiom Space said the suit is nearing its final development stage and has already completed a critical pressurized simulation, the first since Project Apollo.
Copyright 2024 NPR
Tags NPR Top Stories Alana Wise Alana Wise is a politics reporter on the Washington desk at NPR. IPR Shows & Podcasts

author: Teleschau
title: Olga verzweifelt am Kinderwunsch - ihr Umfeld riet ihr, sich vom unfruchtbaren Partner zu trennen
text: "Manchmal k√∂nnte ich so Dialoge f√ºhren mit meiner Geb√§rmutter und sie fragen, was sie eigentlich den ganzen Tag so macht, ob sie eigentlich arbeitslos ist", sagt Alina in die Kamera. Sie f√ºhlt sich "richtig lost" und ist "sauer auf die ganze Welt". Zusammen mit ihrem Mann Daniel (38) m√∂chte die 37-J√§hrige unbedingt noch ein Kind. F√ºr die Real-Life-Serie "Wir wollen ein Baby!" im ZDF gew√§hren sie den Kameras einen Einblick in ihre schwierige Reise. Eine erste k√ºnstliche Befruchtung war vor drei Jahren erfolgreich, doch nun wird es m√ºhsam und schwer. "Damals hatte ich noch eine gewisse Leichtigkeit im Vergleich zu jetzt", erinnert sie sich. Diese sei schon lange weg. "Ich bin gar nicht mehr der Mensch, der ich vor dieser Kinderwunschreise gewesen bin." So wie Alina und Daniel geht es auch den vier andere Paaren, die in "Wir wollen ein Baby!" die Zuschauer mit auf ihre Kinderwunschreise nehmen, beim Gyn√§kologen, im OP-Saal, in der Kinderwunschklinik. Da sind Heike (36) und Dennis (31), die es nach einer Fehlgeburt weiterversuchen wollen, Sabrina (37) und Katharina (41) und Elisa (27) und Noah, die f√ºr ihren Kinderwunsch auf Samenspender angewiesen sind, oder Olga (33) und Serge (35), die mit Unfruchtbarkeit k√§mpfen. "Ich f√ºhle mich kinderlos irgendwie nicht normal", gibt Olga zu. "Es ist eine Mischung aus Hoffnung und Durchdrehen und √Ñngsten und Ausraster", fasst Alina ihre Kinderwunschreise zusammen. Trotzdem machen sie und ihr Mann sich immer wieder auf den Weg in eine Klinik in Prag und probieren es weiter auf nat√ºrlichem Weg. "Man ordnet dem Kinderwunsch alles unter", gesteht Daniel. Es sei "die krasseste Probe f√ºr die Partnerschaft", erkl√§rt Alina. Hohe Kosten f√ºr Kinderwunschbehandlungen Die Klinik in Prag hat sich Alina und Daniel auch wegen der hohen Kosten, die Kinderwunschbehandlungen in Deutschland mit sich bringen, ausgesucht. Damit haben auch die anderen Paare zu k√§mpfen: F√ºr eine hormonelle Selbstbehandlung mit Spritzen, m√ºssen Olga und Serge die H√§lfte des Preises selbst zahlen, 558,66 Euro. Um sich die Behandlungen leisten zu k√∂nnen, verzichten sie auf gemeinsame Urlaube. Eine k√ºnstliche Befruchtung kostet, je nach Zyklus, zwischen 4.000 und 5.000 Euro, Samenspenden k√∂nnen ebenfalls √ºber 1.000 Euro kosten. "F√ºr uns als Frauenpaar ist es besonders herausfordernd, dass wir immer auf einen Samenspender angewiesen sind", erkl√§rt Sabrina. Was es f√ºr sie zus√§tzlich schwer macht, ist, dass Krankenkassen bei homosexuellen Paaren mit Kinderwunsch keine der Kosten √ºbernehmen. Belastungsprobe Kinderwunsch: "Du wirst irgendwann gezwungen, diese Zweifel zu haben" Die Zweifel, Trauer und Entt√§uschung sind jedoch bei allen Paaren gleich. Nach ihrer Fehlgeburt und aufgrund ihrer Endometriose, die f√ºr eine geringere Eizellreserve sorgt, f√§llt es Heike schwer, "dem K√∂rper Vertrauen zu schenken, dass es gut werden kann", erkl√§rt sie. √Ñhnlich geht es Alina. Bereits das siebte Mal versucht sie, mithilfe von k√ºnstlicher Befruchtung schwanger zu werden. Das Kamerateam begleitet sie auch dabei und f√§ngt ein, wie sehr sie ihr eigener Wunsch an ihre Grenzen bringt: "Jetzt will ich heim", sagt sie ersch√∂pft nach einer weiteren OP in Prag. F√ºr Olga und Serge soll es auf ihrer Kinderwunschreise in Zukunft ebenfalls ins Ausland gehen. Bei einer Untersuchung in Spanien soll herausgefunden werden, warum sich Embryonen nicht in Olgas Geb√§rmutter einnisten. Dass Serge fast unfruchtbar ist, wissen sie bereits. "Das hat mich schon ziemlich belastet", gibt er zu. Leute aus ihrem Umfeld h√§tten ihnen sogar geraten, sich deshalb zu trennen. "Du wirst irgendwann gezwungen, diese Zweifel zu haben, an dir selbst, an der Ehe, am Mann", erkl√§rt Olga. Dennoch halten die beiden zueinander. Endlich ein Kind: "Das war der sch√∂nste Tag in meinem Leben" Im Laufe der Serie k√∂nnen Katherina und Sabrina ihre Tochter begr√º√üen und auch Elisa und Noah werden, nach einem fehlgeschlagenen Versuch, Eltern. "Das war der sch√∂nste Tag in meinem Leben!", da ist sich Sabrina sicher. Bei der Geburt per Kaiserschnitt sind die Kameras dabei und fangen das Gl√ºck der jungen Familie ein. F√ºr ihre kleine Tochter w√ºnschen sich die beiden M√ºtter ein Geschwisterchen, doch wieder wird die Kinderwunschreise alles andere als leicht. "Um das zu verarbeiten, haben wir uns bewusst gemacht, dass es vielen Frauen so geht", sagt Sabrina. Die beiden starten einen letzten Versuch. Sollte dieser nicht funktionieren, wollen sie sich beim Jugendamt um ein Pflegekind bem√ºhen, erkl√§rt Katherina. Die Real-Life-Serie "Wir wollen ein Baby!" ist in der ZDF-Mediathek verf√ºgbar.

author: Syndicated Content
title: Reeling Red Wings aim to halt slide in clash vs. Predators
text:
The Detroit Red Wings share an arena with the NBA‚Äôs Pistons, who just broke the single-season league record for most consecutive losses.
The Red Wings aren‚Äôt close to matching that run of futility, however it‚Äôs been a rough December for them as well. They are 2-8-1 over their last 11 games, including a 6-3 road loss to the Minnesota Wild on Wednesday.
Detroit will try to turn things around during a pair of home games before the calendar flips to 2024. The Nashville Predators will visit on Friday and the Boston Bruins will come to town on New Year‚Äôs Eve.
The Red Wings experienced a third-period collapse against the Wild. They tied the game on Alex DeBrincat‚Äôs power-play goal before then allowing four goals in less than 10 minutes.
Coach Derek Lalonde saw it coming.
‚ÄúJust our inability to manage our game,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs unbelievable. We were fortunate to come out of the second at 2-1. They had six Grade A‚Äôs (chances) in the second and they were all off egregious turnovers. The difference in the third is the puck ended in the back of the net off of turnovers where it did not in the second.‚Äù
Detroit had a 14-7-3 record before its slide began. The Red Wings now are in danger of dropping to the .500 mark with a regulation loss to the Predators.
‚ÄúThis was not us over the first 25 games,‚Äù Lalonde said. ‚ÄúWe worked off a forecheck and we were a simple, predictable team. Now, it‚Äôs just blue line turnovers, high offensive zone turnovers, it‚Äôs disappointing.‚Äù
One of the few bright spots has been the production of Patrick Kane, who signed with Detroit as a free agent early in the month. He carries a five-game point streak (five goals, four assists) and four-game goal streak into Friday‚Äôs contest.
The Predators have lost their last two games and three of their last four contests. The Carolina Hurricanes posted a 5-2 win in Nashville on Wednesday.
All of the Hurricanes‚Äô goals came during the first two periods.
‚ÄúI think we were a little careless at times,‚Äù Nashville coach Andrew Brunette said. ‚ÄúI think it was an emotional game. I thought we were excited to play, maybe a little bit too rambunctious a few different times. We took some offensive zone penalties that probably we wouldn‚Äôt like to take.‚Äù
Carolina scored three of its goals with the man advantage.
‚ÄúSpecial teams, we lost that battle (Wednesday), which is frustrating,‚Äù center Ryan O‚ÄôReilly said.
O‚ÄôReilly notched his 14th goal of the season on Wednesday. He trails only Filip Forsberg (16) for the team lead in goals.
‚ÄúI thought we did a lot of good things,‚Äù O‚ÄôReilly said. ‚ÄúObviously, we‚Äôve got to find a way to put the puck in the net a little bit better. We had some chances. Like I said, myself, I‚Äôm better than the shots I was putting on net there. Getting those point-blank opportunities and not putting them in the back of the net, I‚Äôm better than that, for sure.‚Äù
Nashville and Detroit split its two-game series last season. This will be the first of two meetings this season. The rematch will be held in Nashville on March 23.
‚ÄìField Level Media
